title: ED seizes Rs 50 crore assets of mill tied to Pawar kin
FIR in Kohima helps unearth Chinese global laundering syndicate

description: The Enforcement Directorate has discovered extensive manipulation of stocks in the Indian stock market through the use of 'proceeds of crime' derived from a betting syndicate operated by Dubai-based promoters of Mahadev Online Book. This illegal betting platform is currently under investigation, with former Chhattisgarh chief minister Bhupesh Baghel and numerous high-ranking state bureaucrats implicated in the probe.
title: Mahadev owners used 'proceeds of crime' to alter stock markets
Road to Atal tunnel among 370 stretches blocked
PM Modi firm on making life easy for women: Amit Shah
Modi’s Women’s Day ‘gift’: LPG cylinder price cut 100

description: Shortly before the commencement of the code of conduct for the upcoming general elections, Prime Minister Narendra Modi is scheduled to observe a significant tri-service exercise, firepower demonstration, and the exhibition of domestically manufactured weapon systems, equipment, and platforms at Pokhran on March 12.
title: Major military show before poll code kicks in
NIA shares Bengaluru cafe blast suspect’s clip, seeks info
Asked to choose Gandhi or Godse, HC ex-judge says ‘need time to think’

description: The central govt will replace 'ex-serviceman' with gender-inclusive terms to promote gender equality in the defence services. This response comes in light of a petition filed by Capt Sanewal (Retd) before the Punjab and Haryana high court, highlighting the need for inclusive language.
title: Will replace ‘ex-servicemen’ with gender-neutral term, says Centre

description: On Thursday, Uddhav Thackeray, the leader of Shiv Sena (UBT), caused a stir by extending an open invitation to Union minister Nitin Gadkari to join the MVA. This move came after Thackeray highlighted the absence of Gadkari's name in the BJP's initial list of candidates for the upcoming Lok Sabha polls. Responding to Uddhav's statement on Friday, Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis referred to him as a 'gali ka neta'.
title: 'Gali ka neta..': BJP on Uddhav's 'offer' for Nitin Gadkari
15 years after brutal attack, scam-buster back at same dist as IAS

description: The INDIA bloc encountered a setback in Jammu and Kashmir as National Conference vice-president Omar Abdullah dismissed the possibility of a seat arrangement with Mehbooba Mufti's Peoples Democratic Party in the upcoming parliamentary polls. Despite this, he reiterated his dedication to the opposition alliance that encompasses both parties. Omar also issued a word of caution to his fellow INDIA constituents, advising against personal attacks on Prime Minister Narendra Modi, noting that such tactics can ultimately backfire for the opposition.
title: Rifts in opposition bloc, Omar refuses to share seats with PDP

description: In a surprising development ahead of the Lok Sabha elections, Manish Khanduri, the son of former Uttarakhand chief minister Major General B C Khanduri (retd), stepped down from the Congress party on Friday. Through a social media announcement, Manish said that he is stepping down from the primary affiliation with the Indian National Congress and relinquishing all affiliated responsibilities.
title: Ex-CM Manish Khanduri's son quits Congress, may join BJP

description: The Congress party unveiled its first list of candidates for the Lok Sabha elections, with Rahul Gandhi at the forefront. The party expressed its determination to significantly challenge the BJP in the parliamentary contest and signaled its openness to actively pursue alliances, urging potential partners to reciprocate. Rahul Gandhi is set to contest from his current constituency of Wayanad in Kerala, among the 39 candidates listed.
title: Rahul Gandhi from Wayanad, confirms Congress first list

description: Sudha Murty, renowned philanthropist, engineer, and author, was appointed to the Rajya Sabha, filling the sole vacant seat in the nominated category that had remained unoccupied for over 21 months. Her nomination, announced by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on International Women's Day, is hailed as a compelling endorsement of women empowerment, describing her presence in the Rajya Sabha as a formidable testament to the strength of 'Nari Shakti' (women power).
title: Nominated to RS, Sudha Murty says 'I get bigger platform'

description: PM Narendra Modi reveals his recipe for success, a God-given ability to predict the future. He predicts that the youth in India will make a global impact. He presents the National Creators Award and expresses confidence in India's potential in AI and semiconductors. He expects a second edition of the award ceremony and talks about public hygiene in elections.
title: PM Modi: India fashion leader, Konark statue shows girl in mini-skirt

description: The Madhya Pradesh high court recently granted a divorce petition, stating that if a mother tutors a child against their own father, it constitutes cruelty and serves as a valid reason for divorce. The court, led by justices Sheel Nagu and Vinay Saraf, noted that the wife had gone to extreme lengths in making accusations against the husband and his family. The court emphasized that defining cruelty precisely is challenging and depends on the specific circumstances.
title: Mom tutoring kid against dad is cruelty: HC

description: Congress faced a setback on Friday as a tax tribunal rejected its appeal to halt the Income Tax department's recovery proceedings and the attachment of its bank accounts. The Income Tax Appellate Tribunal (ITAT) stated in a comprehensive order that its involvement was unnecessary. An official mentioned, "The department will now proceed to the next stage for recovering the dues," and highlighted that the party could choose to appeal before the high court.
title: Tribunal junks Cong's plea to stay I-T recovery proceedings

description: Union home and cooperation minister Amit Shah launched the National Cooperative Database, mapping details of 8 lakh cooperatives. It promotes expansion of cooperative sector and connects villages to cities, mandis to global market, and state databases to international databases. All states have accepted model bylaws for PACS expansion.
title: Database of 8L cooperatives to help in framing policies: Amit Shah

description: On Thursday night, Nipen Das, the superintendent of Dibrugarh Central Jail, was apprehended in relation to the discovery of electronic devices and digital gadgets found in the cell housing Amritpal Singh, the leader of Waris Punjab De, and his nine associates. The arrest of Das occurred approximately three weeks following the recovery of various items, including a spy-camera pen, a smartphone with a SIM card, a keypad phone, a TV remote with a keyboard, pen drives, Bluetooth headphones, speakers, and a smartwatch from Amritpal's cell.
title: Jail official held under UAPA over gadgets in Amritpal’s cell

description: On Friday, discussions regarding seat-sharing between the BJP, Biju Janata Dal (BJD), and Telugu Desam Party seemed to have hit a deadlock. Despite the party leadership's planned transition to challenging territories like Maharashtra and Bihar, where addressing the demands of allies within the lead NDA player and among themselves was crucial, no resolution had been reached. Negotiations with BJD for the upcoming Lok Sabha and state assembly elections, initially showing signs of smooth progress, were reportedly hindered by disagreements concerning the allocation of Puri and Bhubaneshwar seats, currently held by BJD and BJP, respectively.
title: Disagreement over 2 seats stalls BJP-BJD alliance talks

description: A sub-inspector, identified as Manoj Tomar and in charge of the Inderlok police post in north Delhi, has been suspended for reportedly assaulting members of a congregation during Friday namaz. The incident, captured in a widely circulated video on social media, depicts Tomar pushing and instructing the worshippers to vacate the busy road. Subsequently, he is shown kicking and striking two to three individuals, leading to widespread public outrage.
title: Delhi cop kicks namazis in Inderlok, suspended
'Several countries planning nuclear testing, India & Pak to follow suit'
Pakistan student faces death penalty over WhatsApp message

description: Deepti Sharma bagged only the second hat-trick in the history of the tournament, after her exploits with the bat to hand UP Warriorz a thrilling one-run win over Delhi Capitals in the Women's Premier League on Friday. Deepti scored 59 off 48 balls to take the Warriorz to 138 for 8 in their must-win match. She then returned to pick up a four-wicket haul, including a hat-trick to turn the match on its head for the UP side.
title: WPL: Deepti stars in Warriorz's thrilling 1-run win over DC

description: The International Monetary Fund refused Imran Khan's request for an election audit. IMF focuses on economic issues and aims to help Pakistan implement strong policies for financial stability, address balance of payments challenges, and promote inclusive growth.
title: IMF declines Imran Khan's plea to launch probe into general elections in Pak

description: Around International Women's Day, women bus drivers in Thane and female railway employees at Matunga station celebrated. Isro scientists involved in Chandrayaan-3 mission, including Isro chairman S Somanath, will be felicitated. Harmony Foundation hosted a talk on women empowerment with renowned speakers.
title: Isro's women scientists who led Chandrayaan mission to be honoured

description: Israeli officials consider arming Palestinians in Gaza for secure distribution of humanitarian supplies. Civil order is strained. Israeli troops fired at suspects in a truck convoy incident. Hamas rejected the military's report.
title: Israel plans to equip Gaza civilians with arms: Report

description: Bitcoin reached a record high above $70,000, driven by investor demand for new US spot exchange-traded crypto products and expectations of falling global interest rates. The rally was supported by an upgrade to the ethereum blockchain platform and the upcoming bitcoin "halving" event. Institutional investors, including BlackRock's iShares Bitcoin Trust, have also entered the market.
title: Bitcoin rises to record high over $70,000

description: A United Airlines Boeing 737 Max veered off the runway at George Bush Intercontinental Airport in Houston, US. Passengers safely disembarked and were taken to the terminal. The Federal Aviation Administration confirmed the incident, but no injuries were reported. This comes a day after the Boeing 777 jet of United Airlines made an emergency landing after its wheel fell off.
title: United Airlines flight rolls off Houston runway, all passengers safe

description: Chroming, a dangerous trend on TikTok, involves inhaling toxic fumes to get high. It has caused the death of an 11-year-old boy and is associated with sniffing fumes, bagging concentrated vapours, and huffing toxic substances. Approximately 684,000 adolescents engage in this hazardous practice. According to toxicology specialist Anthony Pizon MD, chroming “is a variation of an old theme of huffing all sorts of hydrocarbons.”
title: What is Chroming, TikTok trend that killed an 11-year-old boy

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced a Rs 100 cut in non-subsidised domestic LPG cylinder prices as a Women’s Day ‘gift’, easing financial burden on households. The government extended Rs 300 subsidy on each cylinder for poor households under Ujjwala scheme. After the latest reduction, domestic LPG refills of 14.2 kg will cost Rs 803 each in Delhi, Rs 802 in Mumbai, Rs 829 in Kolkata and Rs 818.50 in Chennai.
title: PM Modi's women’s day ‘gift’: Rs 100 cut in domestic LPG prices

description: PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate the Sela tunnel, the world’s longest bi-lane tunnel at an altitude above 13,000 feet, in Arunachal Pradesh. The tunnel will enhance all-weather connectivity to Tawang and Kameng regions, reduce travelling distance, and address tactical military disadvantages. Earlier, the route to Sela pass had only single-lane connectivity.
title: Strategically crucial Sela tunnel all set for inauguration

description: Former President Donald Trump criticized President Joe Biden's State of the Union address, accusing him of being 'angry and mentally disturbed.' "He was angry, mentally disturbed, and misrepresenting a lot of the facts concerning almost every subject he discussed," Trump said. Biden, in his hour-long address, criticized Trump for failing in a president's fundamental duty to care.
title: Trump slams Biden, calls him 'angry, mentally disturbed'

description: Displaying composure on the crease and gaining confidence with each run and boundary, Devdutt Padikkal showcased a remarkable performance. He formed a resilient partnership of 97 runs with Sarfaraz Khan, stabilising the host team's innings after the quick dismissals of centurions Rohit Sharma and Shubman Gill in the post-lunch session.
title: Dravid's pep-talk calms Padikkal ahead of Test debut
'People are tired of listening to me': PM's light-hearted exchange

description: Former Maldivian president Mohamed Nasheed, who is in India, voiced concerns about the impact of the 'Boycott Maldives' campaign by Indians. He reflected on the strained India-Maldives relations and the pivot towards China by the new government led by Mohamed Muizzu. Nasheed said that relations with India will return to normal in the future as Muizzu settles down.
title: 'People of Maldives are sorry': Ex-president Nasheed on impact of boycott by Indians

description: Bengaluru's Ramewshwarm Cafe owner confirmed the eatery's reopening. He expressed concern about the recent bomb blast incident and emphasized that such incidents should not occur in India. The restaurant plans to reopen with the national anthem. At least nine people were injured in the low-intensity blast during the busy lunch hour.
title: Ramewshwarm cafe blast: What the owner said about eatery reopening

description: A 'mass bleaching event' is currently taking place on Australia's Great Barrier Reef, endangering diverse marine species. The seventh such event since 1998, climate change is biggest threat to coral reefs. Urgent action is needed to protect ecosystems and dependent plants and animals. Ocean temperatures have reached record levels, risking large-scale coral mortality. The frequency of bleaching events hampers reef recovery.
title: 'Mass bleaching event' threatens Great Barrier Reef's biodiversity

description: Sharing his deep affection for the Indian Premier League, star India batter Virat Kohli has credited the T20 tournament's success to the strong "connect" between players and fans. Kohli has made himself unavailable for the ongoing five-Test series against England due to personal reasons and is expected to be back for Royal Challengers Bangalore in the IPL opener against Chennai Super Kings at the MA Chidambaram Stadium on March 22.
title: Kohli reveals why everyone loves IPL, says 'there's a connect...'

description: Namita Thapar and Vineeta Singh deliver a powerful message on Women's Day, challenging body-shaming and promoting respect for women. They share behind-the-scenes moments from Shark Tank India, highlighting the importance of mental health, self-love, and empowerment. Take a look at the video of Namita and Vineeta.
title: Shark Tank India’s Namita and Vineeta bashes body-shaming on Women’s Day;
'Never benefited from ...': Omar on Lalu's 'Parivarvaad' jibe

description: Krafton partners with Dharma Production's Yodha movie for new content and gameplay in BGMI. Players can participate in the Yodha Challenge and win rewards. Social media contest offers a chance to meet Sidharth Malhotra, gaming influencers, and Raashii Khanna. Yodha movie featuring Disha Patani releases on March 15. Watch the BGMI and Yodha collaboration announcement teaser.
title: BGMI teams up with Karan Johar's Yodha; watch teaser

description: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi will contest from Wayanad. Porika Balram Naik, Ch Vamshi Chand Reddy, K Jaiveer Reddy, K Raghuveer Reddy, and Suresh Kumar Shetkar are among the candidates announced by the All India Congress Committee.
title: LS polls: Congress releases first list of candidates, Rahul to contest from Wayanad

description: Maharashtra deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis announced that Nitin Gadkari would be the first candidate on BJP's Lok Sabha list for the state. Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray criticised the omission and offered the BJP leader an MVA ticket. Fadnavis defended the decision, assuring that Gadkari's name will be included once the seat-sharing discussions take place.
title: Fadnavis takes jibe at Uddhav over his 'MVA ticket offer' to Gadkari

description: When it comes to going for a kitchen chimney, you need to go for the best chimney that has all the features to keep your kitchen smoke, grease and grime free. Take a look at some of the best chimney options for your kitchen for a healthy home and a smoke free environment
title: Best Chimney: Top 10 options from Faber & more that are worth considering

description: Small Savings Scheme Interest Rates April-June 2024: The government has announced the interest rates for small savings schemes for the April-June 2024 quarter.
title: Small savings interest rates April-June 2024 out

description: Enforcement Directorate attaches Rs 50 crore assets of NCP (SP) MLA Rohit Pawar's sugar mill in Kannad, Aurangabad. ED questioned Rohit Pawar in connection with the Maharashtra State Cooperative Bank (MSCB) scam and the purchase of the mill through his company Baramati Agro Pvt Ltd.
title: ED attaches Rohit Pawar’s company assets worth Rs 50 crore

description: Young Indian batter Sarfaraz Khan's  dismissal proved to be a turning point as it triggered a collapse for India. From a position of strength at 376/3, the team stumbled to 428/8, losing quick five wickets in a span of 54 runs, allowing England to make a significant comeback. Sarfaraz, who was well settled at 56 and had forged a promising 97-run partnership with debutant Devdutt Padikkal, squandered a golden opportunity to transform his innings into a potential century.
title: Sarfaraz's dismissal made Gavaskar recall Bradman's lesson

description: India captain Rohit Sharma exhibited his exceptional form in the fifth and final Test against England in Dharamsala. Achieving his 12th Test century against the Three Lions, Rohit not only showcased his batting prowess but also effectively countered the England bowling attack. His stellar performance played a pivotal role in extending India's dominance in the five-match series, where they already held an unassailable 3-1 lead.
title: Rohit Sharma equals Dravid, Gavaskar's record

description: A recent incident on a Batik Air flight from South East Sulawesi to Jakarta, Indonesia, saw both pilot and co-pilot doze off for almost 28 minutes. Despite some navigation errors, the 153 passengers and four flight attendants on board were unharmed. The National Transportation Safety Committee (KNKT) released a preliminary report highlighting the incident. Thankfully, no harm was caused during the two-hour flight.
title: Pilots 'fall asleep', with 153 passengers onboard

description: India solidified their dominance in the final Test against England, finishing day two with a commanding 255-run lead, courtesy of centuries from captain Rohit Sharma and Shubman Gill. Closing the day at 473-8, the hosts showcased their batting prowess at the picturesque Dharamsala stadium, nestled against the backdrop of the snowcapped Himalayas. In the serene surroundings, Kuldeep Yadav (27) and Jasprit Bumrah (19) took to the crease, contributing to India's strong position.
title: 5th Test: India stretch lead to 255 after Rohit, Gill centuries

description: The standout moment from Shubman Gill's impressive 110-run innings on the second day of the fifth Test against England in Dharamsala was his stylish six, confidently dispatching James Anderson straight down the ground. Both Gill and Anderson were also seen having a chat after the Indian batter hit him running down the track into the crowd. On being asked what the chat was about, Gill refused to divulge the details and said it should be in private.
title: Gill refuses to reveal chat with Anderson after mighty six

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi presented the National Creators Awards to over 200 creators across 23 categories, celebrating their contributions to positive social change and innovation. Ranveer Allahbadia, Naman Deshmukh, and Kabita Singh were among the winners.
title: PM Modi announces National Creators Award 2024: List of winners

description: Delhi Police suspended a sub-inspector for mercilessly kicking and hitting people who were offering Namaz on the side of a road. The incident happened during the 'Asar ki namaz' near Inderlok Metro Station. Locals demanded action and security has been increased in the area. Reports indicate the men were praying outside because the mosque was filled to capacity.
title: Delhi cop suspended for 'kicking' man offering Namaz

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi presented the National Creators Award, urging digital content creators to showcase India's culture and heritage. He emphasized the importance of engaging a global audience and recognized the transformative impact of the data revolution and cheap mobile phones. The awards aim to drive positive change and recognize excellence across twenty-three categories.
title: PM Narendra Modi gives 'important task' to content creators in India

description: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has made amendments to credit and debit card regulations to enhance transparency and accountability. The amendments cover various aspects, including business credit cards, penalties for card closure delays, form factors in place of debit cards, co-branded cards, compensation for grievances, and data protection guidelines.
title: RBI updates credit and debit card rules; What it means
I-T tribunal junks Congress' plea to stay action on its bank accounts

description: A Junior Commissioned Officer named Konsam Kheda Singh has been abducted by anti-social elements, possibly related to extortion, in Manipur's Thoubal district. Security agencies are conducting a coordinated search operation along National Highway 102. This incident marks the fourth such occurrence since the conflict in Manipur began, where soldiers, their kin, or those on duty have been targeted.
title: Army officer abducted in Manipur, search op launched

description: With notable figures such as Virat Kohli and KL Rahul absent, Indian captain Rohit Sharma takes charge and leads his team admirably in the five-match Test series against England. Rohit showcased his leadership by securing his second century of the series, hitting a remarkable 103 on Day 2 of the fifth Test in Dharamsala.
title: Rohit fans troll Boycott again after his century
Several Indians duped into working in Russian army, says Centre

description: Google's Bay View building in Mountain View has inadequate Wi-Fi connectivity. Workers use ethernet cables and phone hotspots for internet service. Google acknowledges the issue and plans improvements to fix it in the coming weeks.
title: Google's new 'wholly-own built' office has an 'internet problem'

description: Maha Shivratri, celebrated on March 8, marks the night of the marriage of Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati. It celebrates the convergence of 'Shiva' and 'Shakti' and the night when Lord Shiva performed the 'Tandav'--the cosmic dance. You can virtually join Maha Aartis at various temples through their live streams.
title: How to participate in Maha Aartis virtually at these 8 Jyotirlings

description: A 16-year-old JEE aspirant, Abhishek Mandal from Bhagalpur, died by suicide in his Kota PG room. He expressed distress over not cracking the JEE in a suicide note. This marks the fifth coaching student suicide in Kota this year.
title: 'Sorry papa, I quit': Another JEE aspirant dies by suicide in Kota

description: PM Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojana is a government scheme that offers subsidies for solar panels to eligible individuals. The scheme requires Indian citizenship, suitable roof for solar panels, valid electricity connection, and no prior subsidies for solar panels. Individuals can register on the national website and choose their preferred manufacturer and supplier for the rooftop solar system.
title: PM Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojana: FAQs on eligibility answered

description: Shubman Gill showed a significant turnaround in his form during the Test series against England. His father, Lakhwinder Gill, attributed this to his decision to revert to his attacking instincts by stepping out to the bowlers, a technique ingrained in him since his Under-16 days. This resurgence in form marked a significant turnaround in his cricket career.
title: 'No. 3 is not right for him at all...': Shubman Gill's father
'Ganja is as easy as getting toffee or lollipop'

description: Key US government websites went down before Biden's State of the Union address due to an internet disruption. Outages were reported by DHS, FEMA, CBP, ICE, USCIS, and US Secret Service. DHS is investigating the outage and working to restore the sites as soon as possible. Several US companies' websites also experienced outages this week.
title: Some of the biggest US govt websites suffer outage: Dept of Homeland Security's statement

description: Maha Shivratri is a Hindu festival celebrating the union of Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati. Devotees exchange wishes through WhatsApp stickers. Here's how to download and share Maha Shivratri stickers, and create messages using AI chatbots. Users can either search on Google for Shivratri messages or use AI chatbots like Gemini, ChatGPT or Microsoft Copilot to generate Maha Shivratri messages.
title: How to download, share Maha Shivratri stickers on WhatsApp

description: 14 children in Rajasthan's Kota were electrocuted during a Mahashivratri procession. They were rushed to a nearby hospital. Amrita Duhan, SP, said one child is in a serious condition with 100% burns. Police are investigating the sad incident.
title: 14 children suffer burn injuries during procession in Kota

description: Shubman Gill's fearless six off James Anderson in the fifth Test between India and England at Dharamshala impresses Harsha Bhogle and Ben Stokes. A nonchalant Shubman Gill charged down the pitch and lofted the full delivery bowled at 131 kmph by Anderson handsomely straight down the ground into the crowd.
title: Watch: Gill's six off Anderson gets Stokes' nod of approval

description: The dearness allowance (DA) for central government employees has been increased by 4% to reach 50%. Dearness relief (DR) for central government pensioners has also been increased to 50%. The DA hike will lead to an increase in the take-home salary of employees and will also affect other components of the salary, such as house rent allowance (HRA), daily allowance, and gratuity ceiling.
title: 50% DA hike: New take home salary, HRA & gratuity explained

description: In the fifth Test between India and England, Rohit Sharma and Shubman Gill demonstrated their dominance with a 171-run partnership for the second wicket. Sharma scored his 12th Test century, while Gill secured his fourth century. However, England's skipper Ben Stokes and veteran pacer James Anderson initiated a swift comeback after the lunch break, claiming two crucial wickets.
title: Watch: Ben Stokes' 'magic ball' to end Rohit's top knock

description: PM Modi expressed delight at President Droupadi Murmu's Rajya Sabha nomination of Sudha Murty, calling it a powerful testament to our Nari Shakti. Murty, the spouse of Infosys co-founder N R Narayana Murthy, serves as the chairperson of the Murty Trust and boasts authorship of numerous books. At 73 years old, her nomination coincides with International Women's Day. She received the Padma Shri award in 2006 and the Padma Bhushan in 2023.
title: Sudha Murty nominated to Rajya Sabha; 'powerful testament to Nari Shakti, says PM Modi

description: The main spire and another spire of the Ram temple in Ayodhya will be constructed by Dec. The temple will have five peaks, with three already prepared. Temples of Hindu saints and devtas will also be built in the premises. Over 75 lakh devotees have visited the temple.
title: Gold-plated main spire of Ram temple to be ready by Dec

description: Kuldeep Yadav took 5/72 to bowl out England for 218 in their first innings on the first day of the 5th Test in Dharamshala. Ravichandran Ashwin, who had taken four wickets in his 100th Test, asked Kuldeep to lead the team off. Mohammed Siraj convinced Ashwin to accept the offer. BCCI shared a video of the moment.
title: How Ashwin persuaded Kuldeep to lead teammates off the field

description: During the fifth Test between India and England in Dharamsala, captain Rohit Sharma mentored the inexperienced Indian team by adjusting the fielding positions of Sarfaraz Khan and Yashasvi Jaiswal after a DRS drama. Sharma, known for his affable demeanor, guided the team through the series, eliciting laughter from the young players.
title: Watch: Rohit puts Sarfaraz in place, ensues laughter on-field

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi presents the National Creators Award at Bharat Mandapam in Delhi to recognize young talent. Awardees included singer Maithili Thakur who got the 'Cultural Ambassador of the Year award', Gaurav Chaudhary for the Best Creator in Tech Category award, Kamiya Jani for the Favourite Travel Creator award, and Keerthika Govindasamy for best story teller award.
title: PM Modi presents 1st ever National Creators Award

description: Murlidhar Prajapati and Surendra Yadav from Baran city killed Om Prakash Bairwa for refusing oral sex. Bairwa's body was found in a dry pond. Prajapati arrested, while Yadav consumed poison and is being treated under police guard.
title: Two held in Rajasthan for killing friend for resisting oral sex

description: India captain Rohit Sharma made an error in a DRS call in the Dharamsala Test, when England opener Zak Crawley missed a shot off India spinner Kuldeep Yadav. Sarfaraz Khan, who had appealed for a wicket, couldn't convince his skipper. Sharma declined a DRS request, but replays and UltraEdge confirmed Crawley edged the ball.
title: Watch: Rohit acknowledges DRS call error with a smile

description: The body of Indian worker Patnibin Maxwell, killed in Lebanon, has been sent to India. Indian nationals were urged to relocate to safe areas within Israel. Hezbollah launched the attack in support of Hamas during the Gaza Strip conflict. Seven Indian workers were injured, with Bush Joseph George recovering well.
title: Body of Indian worker killed in Israel attack returns to India

description: Sunrisers Hyderabad has unveiled their new jersey for the Indian Premier League 2024 season, featuring a vibrant design reflecting the team's spirit. The team had earlier also announced the appointment of former New Zealand spinner Daniel Vettori as head coach and Australia's Pat Cummins as new captain, signaling a shift in leadership dynamics.
title: Sunrisers unveils 'fiery' new jersey for IPL 2024 season

description: To tackle Bengaluru's acute water crisis, Karnataka Water Supply and Sewerage Board has banned the use of drinking water for car washing, gardening, construction, water fountains, and road construction. Violators will be fined Rs 5,000. Thousands of borewells have dried up, leading to a tripling of private tanker water prices.
title: Bengaluru: Drinking water for car washing, gardening banned

description: International Women’s Day is celebrated every year on March 8th. The day honors the achievements of the women in our lives and thus we have compiled a list of Women’s Day wishes for your mothers, sisters, girlfriends, and friends so that you can remind them to be strong and thank them immensely for their care.
title: Best Int'l Women's Day wishes & messages for wife, mother, g/f

description: A Boeing 777 jet made an emergency landing after a wheel fell off, damaging cars. Flight redirected to Los Angeles. United Airlines plane missing a wheel but landed safely. Boeing facing quality control issues, including grounding of Boeing 737 Max 9s. FAA instructs Boeing to improve quality control within 90 days.
title: Plane makes emergency landing after wheel falls off during takeoff

description: The creator of Japan's hugely popular "Dragon Ball" comics and anime cartoons, Akira Toriyama, has died aged 68, his production team said Friday. "We are deeply saddened to inform you that Manga creator Akira Toriyama passed away on March 1st due to acute subdural hematoma," said a statement posted on the official X account of the "Dragon Ball" franchise.
title: 'Dragon Ball' creator Akira Toriyama passes away at 68

description: Chennai Super Kings captain MS Dhoni returned to the Chepauk Stadium for the Indian Premier League 2024, bringing excitement to the city. Fans eagerly awaited the arrival of their cricketing heroes, with CSK's official social media sharing a heartwarming video. The iconic yellow CSK team bus made its way towards the stadium, eliciting cheers from every corner.
title: Watch: Dhoni returns to Chepauk for IPL preparations

description: "During my visit, I had the privilege of meeting Mrs Akie Abe, the wife of the late PM Shinzo Abe. I expressed my gratitude for PM Shinzo Abe's invaluable efforts in advancing our bilateral ties," Jaishankar tweeted. ​Abe, aged 67, tragically passed away on July 8, 2022, after being shot during a campaign speech in Nara, Japan. Jaishankar, who is currently visiting Tokyo, expressed his appreciation for Abe's significant contributions to strengthening the India-Japan relationship.
title: Jaishankar meets late Japan PM Shinzo Abe's widow Akie

description: On International Women's Day, PM Modi reduced cooking gas cylinder prices, easing financial burden. The government extended the subsidy for poor women under Ujjwala Yojana, supporting well-being and a healthier environment. Modi reaffirmed commitment to empowering women and 'Ease of Living'.
title: Women's Day: PM Modi announces Rs 100 cut in LPG price

description: This has been a groundbreaking series for left-arm wrist spinner Kuldeep Yadav, not least because he has played four Tests in succession in a career which has seen him play just 11 Tests before this since debut in 2017. That debut, incidentally, was here in Dharamshala, marking a line in the sand for this special talent.
title: 5th Test: In fitness of things, Kuldeep Yadav steals the spotlight

description: Google celebrates International Women's Day with a doodle highlighting women's progress and contributions towards gender equality. The doodle acknowledges IWD marches, wage gaps, reproductive rights, prevention of violence against women, United Nations' commemoration, fair employment, voting rights, public office, and the courageous acts of those before them.
title: Google celebrates Women's Day with a colourful doodle

description: Learn how to use Google Lens for real-time translation. Download the app, open it, select 'Translate', and point the camera at the text. Customize your translation experience and ensure a stable internet connection for accurate results.
title: How to translate text in real-time using Google Lens

description: China's push for self-sufficiency targets US tech companies like Dell, IBM, HP, Cisco Systems, Microsoft, and Oracle. Chinese leader Xi Jinping aims to make China less dependent on the West and focus on domestic supply chains. Western companies can tap into opportunities in advanced tech and sales to multinational companies in China.
title: Inside 'Delete A', China's plan to 'delete everything America in tech

description: Pornhub, along with other online platforms, is contesting its classification under the EU's DSA. The challenge includes user numbers, specific regulations, and advertising-related obligations. The DSA aims to combat illegal content and increase transparency in content moderation.
title: Why Pornhub is telling European Union got 'our users number wrong'

description: Founders of a snacks company offer a healthy replacement for snacks on Shark Tank India. They discuss marketing strategy, unit economics, and using wedding savings in their business. Despite challenges and sharks' refusal to invest, they remain determined to build their business. Take a look at what the fight was all about.
title: Shark Tank India 3: Azhar Iqubal, Vineeta get into heated argument
71-yr-old Delhi doc loses Rs 8.6L in sextortion trap, 2 held

description: Dolly Sohi, who battled Cervical Cancer, passed away. Her sister Amandeep Sohi also passed away due to Jaundice. Dolly had to quit the show Jhanak due to health complications. She is survived by her daughter Amelie. The actress has been a part of many TV shows and her recent hits were Parineetii and Jhanak.
title: Jhanak fame Dolly Sohi passes away at 48

description: International Women's Day, observed on March 8, celebrates women's achievements and emphasizes gender equality and women's well-being. Women play a multifaceted role, contributing to family, economy, justice, and social progress. Empowering women benefits society by creating an inclusive, equitable world. This year's theme for International Women's Day is "Invest in women: Accelerate progress".
title: Happy Women's Day 2024: Images, quotes, wishes and more
Sebi bars JM Financial from managing bond offers
Tata Sons looking at debt rejig to avoid IPO next year
